oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LeMoyne College Library, Steele Hall
Library Interior, LeMoyne College
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hooks Brothers Photographers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Schools
African American college students; African American universities and colleges; College buildings
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Scene of male and female students seated at rectangular library tables inside a large open room with a bookshelves lining the walls and a central circulation desk under an archway. Double-hung twelve over twelve pane windows are visible on two sides of the room. Printed on image at bottom right: Hooks Bros. Photographers, 228 Linden Avenue, Memphis, Tenn.

In 1914, the school was moved from Orleans Street to its present site on Walker Avenue. Steele Hall, completed circa 1908, is the oldest building on campus. It originally housed the college library, which now occupies a modern building nearby.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Courtesy LeMoyne-Owen College Library Special Collections
